Socialism? America? The USA is a puritan nation all the way. I think Chavez and his ilk are denigrated so much because they help to deflect attention from the misdeeds of the perceived 'good guys'. Chavez is far from a saint, but he's no more corrupt and power-hungry than Bush, Blair, Brown et al. Chavez is the latest in a long line of hate figures designed to whip up jingoisitc fervour and bolster the military-industrial complex. The fact that he isn't reliant on US economic assistance also makes him a 'dangerous tyrant,' as he can't be controlled through the conventional channels.

I am amazed that any leader who doesn't immediately join with Bush and turn over their resources, is labeled a criminal.  "You're either with us or against us"  I also don't understand why these topics don't interest the average American?  But as bad as Chavez is, we still get oil from him as a "donation" to those in poverty.  In other words, you're a bad guy, but we'll take your free oil.  It boggles the mind.

Thanks for this! is very important at least for me to know both side versions (US & Venezuela)

Also watch if interested on this matter "The war on democracy (2007)" from John Pilger great documentary.
thanks for the film. dictatorship (my arse) or not.. we need more nations to stand up and be counted against imperial powers.
